titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: The unseasonably warm weather continues, and is no doubt a merciful anodyne to a society
which can either get no coal, or cannot afford to buy what is to be gotten
. Horace Walpole, in the year of the London earthquake, noted that the weather in February was "unnaturally hot". He noticed also the wonderful sunsets which "M

Chute's "Francesco" interpreted as a sign of an earthquake "within a week". The recent earthquake in Mexico is proof enough of seismic activity. With Bolshevism rampant we might be spared earthquakes.
I went to the cathedral at 8 a.m., & received the Holy Communion. Instead of going to Mattins, I wrote letters to Temple, Philip, M
Nicholas Church. Ella, his Mother, & Bateman were witnesses
. I gave him a prayer–book as a memento of the occasion. He made his responses manfully.
I went to Evensong in the Cathedral, and heard a good anthem by Travers, and an indifferent sermon by the Archdeacon of Hereford.
